page.title: 09WATER SUPPLY EDINBURGH
page.content: In our block we have the main water treatment plants for the city of Edinburgh. These are at Fairmilehead and Alnwickhill, and to the West the old source at Comiston Springs. These water works are on high ground overlooking the city which helps keep a good pressure in the taps in our homes. Water is piped from the main supply at Talla Reservoir about 40 miles to the South in the Border Hills. The water is filtered through gravel and sand to remove impurities and then treated chemically to make sure it is safe to drink. At Fairmilehead there is the main office from where the engineers and workmen are controlled. Many of the small reservoirs round Edinburgh are used to control the water level in the burns and give an extra supply in an emergency.
